result.execSummary:
The defendant Gkarr L Piggee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 15 years bifurcated sentence.  CORRECTED 07-31-2015:  Severity class corrected to Felony B.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain high school diploma or equivalent. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. Stay out of all bars, taverns and liquor stores. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Complete a mental health assessment and follow recommendations. Participate in life skills therapy. No contact with the co-defendants.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

FT employment

no hard copy of the jury instructions were filed by the court.  Judge read all of the instructions in their entirety on the record and therefore are a part of the record.
all exhibits are paper and are placed in the file in an envelope
Guilty on all 5 counts with enhancers
***BOND IS REVOKED.  DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND UNTIL SENTENCING***
Sentencing hearing on April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gkarr L Piggee in court with attorney Antoinette Lynn Rich.  Defendant Gkarr L Piggee in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue. (TRNS filed 3/25/2015)  Day 2  Jury Instructions are to be read and submitted to the jury  100, 103, 112 - Counts 1,2,3,4, and 5., 1070, 1345, without add on language, 400, 140, 145, 147, 148, 155, 157, 160, 170, 180, 190, 195, 300 with paragraph relative to def. testifying, 315, 460, 42, 44 and 515.  Alternate will be selected before verdict forms are read.  9:30 am break
Back on the record 
Ready to proceed to closings
Bailiff brings in the jury
Closing argument by State
Closing argument by Defense
Rebuttal argument by State

Judge reads Jury Instructions to the Jury.  Alternate is chosen and leaves the courtroom.  Verdict forms are read to the Jury.
Oath to Bailiffs is given by the clerk.  Judge hands Jury Instructions and Verdicts to the Bailiff.  Jury is excused to begin deliberations.
There are no further matters before the court at this time.

Court is adjourned.  

Attorneys agree that any and all evidence may be given to the Jury upon their request.  

Back on the record 
Jury submitted question to the court.  Attorneys are present, defendant is not present.  Judge and attorneys agree on a response and the response is sent in to the Jury.
Adjourned.

Back on the record  

Ct. 1-found GUILTY PTAC Att. 1st deg intentional homicide
Ct. 2-found GUILTY-PTAC 1st deg. RES
Ct. 3-found GUILTY-PTAC 1st deg. RES
Ct. 4-found GUILTY-PTAC 1st deg. RES
Ct. 5-found GUILTY-PTAC 1st deg. RES
The jurors are polled by the Judge
The Jury is thanked for their service and are excused.

State moves for Judgment on the Verdict
Defense moves for Judgment not withstanding the verdict
States motion is granted.
Bail is revoked.
